author: mariohavel
content: I think you kind of answered yourself. There is no reason to promote yourself as former fellow if you haven't contributed. Fellowship is fully open in a way that all contributions are public so anyone can verify your claims so it would be more harmful than productive

author: baba_yaga69420
content:
Yes but it seems like the devrel of nethermind  <@761604431284011039> (Aayush Giri)  is advertising himself as a protocol fellow even though he has not contributed . 
Source- https://www.starknet.io/blog/starknet-hacker-house-why-our-mentors-are-your-products-best-friend/

author: baba_yaga69420
content: I mean, its possible for them to lie in their resume , and also asking if you condone this?

author: mariohavel
content: Thanks for pointing this out. He reached out to us before EPF5 but haven't participated at all. In this case, I would ask <@761604431284011039> not to use EPF in his resume

author: mariohavel
content: Ah you were NB Fellows? Next Billion fellowship is something different than protocol fellowship. I understand there might be confusion

author: baba_yaga69420
content: I think that was a lie too. https://nxbn.ethereum.foundation/fellowship you can see past fellows here.

author: .aayush.eth
content: there was my misunderstanding of openness of the program
